thread.title: Defense lifts Hendrickson to win in Pflugerville football rivalry
thread.title_full: Defense lifts Hendrickson to win in Pflugerville football rivalry | www.statesman.com

author: Butch Hart
title: Defense lifts Hendrickson to win in Pflugerville football rivalry
text:
D.J. Johnson scored three touchdowns as Hendrickson (6-1, 4-0) edged Pflugerville (1-6, 1-3) 22-6 to capture the crosstown District 13-6A contest for the fourth straight season Oct. 16 at Hawk Stadium.
Johnson capped a three-play drive with a 30-yard scoring run on the first Hendrickson possession, then the two teams settled into a fierce defensive contest that the Hawks led 7-0 after a quarter.
Pflugerville closed the margin in the start of the second quarter when Alex Shillow fielded a Hendrickson punt at the Panther 35-yard line, cut right, ducked inside the coverage then raced 65 yards for the touchdown. The extra point attempt failed, leaving the Panthers down 7-6.
Hendrickson running back D.J. Jackson scored three times to lift the Hawks to a 22-6 win over rival Pflugerville. Photo by Ben Conlan 512action.com for the Pflugerville Pflag. Photo by Ben Conlan 512action.com for the Pflugerville Pflag. 9-25-15 Hendrickson’s Johnson added his second score of the night on a 12-yard run to close the second quarter scoring, sending the Hawks into halftime with a 14-6 lead.
Johnson’s 5-yard fourth quarter jaunt capped the Hawks scoring in a game that saw the high-powered Hendrickson offense limited to 261 total yards. However, the Hawks held Pflugerville to 150 yards of total offense.
The victory was a Hawk tuneup for next Friday’s showdown against Round Rock, who improved to 6-1 overall and 5-0 in district after beating Cedar Ridge (6-1, 3-1). The Hawks host Cedar Ridge the following week as the titans of District 13-6A face off for playoff positioning.
Despite the loss, Pflugerville remains alive in pursuit of the fourth and final playoff spot and hosts Westwood next Friday
